title: Think this is a bad hotel? It is worst than that.
text: I didn't like this hotel, and I would not recommend it to my worst enemy. Front staff not attentive. Room is dusty, smells musty and very old. Ancient. Pillows are ancient and full of disgusting yellow stains. Pillow cases had various types of stains, including blood, and a series of weird indescribable large and small stains -- yellow, purple, etc. Very old and tired bedding. Bed corners full of dust and little piles probably due to years of accumulation of exfoliated skin cells and other detritus.  Dust bunnies around the corners of the room, a hairball on the bathroom rug.  The bedding is so disgusting that I decided to encase a pillow on one of my t-shirts before going to bed. I also  decided to sleep on my long sleeves and jeans so i don't get my skin touching the numerous disgusting stains that I saw -- and the ones i didn't see. Wearing long sleeves and pants are also a good protection from the population of mosquitoes in the room--after I laid down mosquitoes tried to bite me. Note to self -- bring more DEET or malaria pills. The only bathroom light was broken -- which in a way was good: it makes it hard to see the other possible stains. But major problems with the bathroom were that the bathroom ceramics (sink and bowl) had major yellow stains--probably mineralization due to age. Bath Tub had numerous stained cracks and corners had weird yellow things accumulated.  Bring your own water--they announce that the hotel will provide "crystalline pure water" but that's not true -- no bottled water in the bedroom. Overall the brown decor (curtains and furniture) with dark brown motifs from the 70's has aged well and shows the appropriate signs of the long decades of hard use and lack of sanitary care.

Lage des Hotels
Das Hotel liegt zentral, direkt um die Ecke ist eine Einkaufsstraße und mehrere Banken, ein sog liquor-shop findet sich in der Parterre des Gebäudes

Ausstattung (Rezeption, Aufenthaltsräume, Zimmer, Restaurant)
Die Ausstattung des Hotels ist von einfacher Qualität. Man merkt den Möbeln und sonstigen Ausstattungsgegenständen Verschleißerscheinungen an. Sauberkeit,Funktionalität der Ausstattung
Wenn man indische Maßstäbe anlegt, dann war das Hotel sauber, allzu genau hingucken sollte man aber nicht. Wie in fast allen besuchten Hotels liefen im TV nur indische Sender. Zumindest hier hätte ich Deutsche Welle oder BBC erwartet. FREE WiFi war vorhanden.

Service
Nichts Auffälliges, alles im Rahmen des Normalen

Qualität des Essen
Das Hotelrestaurant bot gute indische Küche, preiswertes  Essen, eine umfangreiche Speisekarte, sogar nichtvegetarisches Essen, und das will in Gujarat etwas heißen. Der Service war aufmerksam und bemüht. Bei zwei Besuchen waren wir die einzigen Gäste.

text:
We stayed here for what should of been 2 nights. 

We booked a taj view room but couldn’t even see the Taj! So just bear that in mind if you book a room with a view. The window in the room would allow all noise in, as the hotel is on a main road you would think they would put some sort of sound proof on the windows. You could hear every car, bird, beep, person. Although being in India this is something you are used too and this wasn’t the actual Issue. The issue we had was that the rooftop bar was playing loud base music until gone 1am. It was awful. We called reception to ask when this music was stopping, they said ‘soon’. 
There was also kids running up and down the stairwell and through the corridor causing so much noise. So with the kids the music and the general traffic noise we couldn’t sleep and decided to leave the hotel at 1.30am in the morning.

Whilst leaving the room we could see the children running up and down the stairs coming from the rooftop bar, so I am assuming their parents were using the bar and restaurant up there. 

We also noticed 2 members of staff walking up and down the stairs who would have been fully aware of how much noise those kids were making. 

Upon leaving the hotel we told the reception staff of our complaints- no apology was given to us. 

Overall I wouldn’t be booking this hotel again and would advise others not too if you like your sleep. 

The only member of staff who we were delighted to see was the man who greeted you by opening the hotel door. We can’t remember his name but he was lovely. Everyone else was rude and not accommodating what so ever.

title:
DO NOT STAY HERE!
WORST HOTEL IN AHMEDABAD.
text:
Summary:
This is not a 4 star hotel so ignore the ratings online (1 star, if any).
- Cockroaches in the rooms,
- Filthy towels (even with lipstick marks from previous guests as shown in my pictures), dirty bedding and entire room left like a big dustbin,
- Old guest's food left outside rooms on most floors, 
- Heavily rusted bathroom taps, 
- Everything is worn out, smelly and tired looking.

All the pictures shown online appear to be from when the hotel first opened as it looks nothing like it in real life. 

Booking:
We had originally booked for 5 nights but cancelled that as soon as we reached and only ended up staying 1 night due to being too late to find another hotel.

When we reached we thought we would give it the benefit for the doubt, but when shown the rooms we were disgusted.

Hygiene (lack of):
Most pillow covers have stains on them and the pillows themselves are so brown and full of marks that it makes you wonder if they dip them in sewage to "clean them".

Yes staff were happy to quickly show us other rooms but even those rooms all had similar issues.
Why have they let such a big hotel get in such a bad state!?

In the end we settled with two alternative rooms which we asked them to fully clean only because we were too tired to complain anymore.
After cleaning, it had a really off damp smell as if they had cleaned it using dirty water, and although we asked for toilet roll (as they had not replaced it) that never arrived.
Furthermore, even after cleaning we were visited by cockroaches! (A very bad sign of hygiene).

We ended up sleeping with our own clothes and towels under and over ourselves as we didn't trust the bedding here.

Reviews:
The replies on all negative reviews from the hotel are mostly all a copy and paste statement so that shows a lack of wanting to improve.

Pictures:
You'll see evidence of most things I've mentioned in my photos. Let's hope the hotel doesn't somehow remove them to hide the facts.

Overall:
Our one night has dampened our experience of Ahmedabad already and I hope no one else has to experience our bad stay at Cambay.

I also worry that there is a lack of bad photos on review sites and so many positive reviews (from new accounts). This could show fake accounts being used to make it sound better than it is.

We left after the one night and booked "Hotel 440 A Serene Stay" instead, which yes is a little more expensive, by my gosh it's a hell of a lot better and in a better location! 

Advice:
DO NOT STAY AT CAMBAY AS YOU WILL BE DISAPPOINTED.

title: Not a hotel, a night club! Do not stay here!!
text:
Came to Agra to visit the Taj Mahal at Sunset on Sunday morning. From 10/11pm all we could hear and feel was the bass from a nightclub on the 4th floor (our room was on the 2nd). Knowing we were getting up at 4am, we complained and told it should finish at 2am. They offered a room on the 1st floor, but it was still loud. We were not told when we checked-in and was not on their website, despite it appearing to be a regular thing. It didn't stop until 3am, leaving us 1 hour of sleep. 
Prior to the club starting, at 9pm we were told the 4th floor bar was closed. It obviously wasn't and we got the impression from previous reviewers that this hasn't been the first time either, and so think it's only for locals only.

We tried to complain to the Manager at 7am and were told to wait 30mins. At 7:45 we tried again and told to wait 30mins. At 9am when we wanted to check-out, he arrived 15mins later after us threatening to leave. He was very rude and was clearly did not want to have to deal with us, walking away multiple times. They were happy to give us a 15% discount, but we did not feel this reasonable and called the Tourist Police. They were very helpful and helped us get the room to a reasonable price.

I don't know if this happens every night, but DO NOT stay here on a Saturday night. The manager cares more about his night club than his guests. If you have any issues though, give the Tourist Police a call- they're there to help in such situations.

title: ABSOLUTELY STAY AWAY, this is no Hotel, it is a night club
text: I stayed at the hotel 27 to 29 April, on top floor there is a really nice rooftop restaurant and bar and techno club, serving really nice food but far from local price. Every night on top floor, play loud music from 9pm until 3 to 4 am in the morning, we arrived in the weekend so the music was unbearable. They said they put us on third floor with view to the Taj and we were excited...but what comes at 9pm shocked us...from around midnight all the indien guests or other from outside went up for party...jumping horribly we can hear in our room so clear...the lamp on the sealing shaking .... I complained twice to the poor receptionist but nothing he can do as rooms were fully booked and it is management desire to run hotel this way. This hotel is not a place to sleep because you will not be able to, if there isn’t party in the basement, there is party on the top floor every night. Receptionist told us that music will stop at 2am but 3am went and still boom boom boom in our room. We plan to go to Taj Mahal in the morning, this option wont be possible if you stay here. Room is ok for the price, bathroom but no hot water in the bathroom. We have no problem with air conditioner. We requested 2 single bed and paid for larger room but got 1 double bed for 2 boys so they have to bring extra bed for my mate to sleep. Pay a little more and get a better hotel, this establishment does not runs a hotel, they run night clubs and party.  Final word, if you come for restaurant and rooftop clubbing, this is the place..it has really modern restaurant and club but if you are here to sleep and rest...you will not get to that.

title: Attention aux arnaques !
text:
Nous avons dormi à cet hôtel la nuit dernière, nous étions charmés par la propreté de la chambre et le roovtop jusqu a se que nous remarquions que nous nous faisions arnaquer..
Tout d’abord 
nous avons booker une chambre à 30 euros 40 et arrivés à l hôtel on a du payé 36euros60 soit environ 20 % de taxe en plus c’est inadmissible en Inde.. nous avions réservé une chambre à deux lits simples et baignoire et on nous a donné un seul lit double et une douche. 
Ensuite comme il est proposé sur le site nous voulions aller au spa, à l’accueil ils ont été incapable de nous dire ou nous pourrions trouver un spa. Il ne savait même pas nous montrer où nous étions situé sur la carte..
Nous voulions prendre un bus pour allé visiter un fort à environ 1heure de la ville et ils nous ont dit qu il n y avait pas de bus mais que des taxi, en nous proposant un taxi à 3000 roupi, wawe! Au final il y a des bus pour y aller à 45 roupi.. et les taxi ne demandaient que 1400 roupi. Et ils nous ont refait le coup en nous disant qu il n y avait pas de bus pour aller à Jaipour et qu ils pouvaient nous trouver un taxi.. je pense qu ils ont des commissions sur les taxi et abusent sur les prix et mentent sur les autres moyens de transports..
Et ce n est pas fini, méfiez vous du personnel de l’accueil, nous avons du réclamer après avoir payé qu il nous rende la monnaie.. même si ce n’était que 50roupi c’est inimaginable dans un hôtel. 
Pour finir nous avons demandé un service pressing, ils n ont pas été capable de nous annoncer un prix, nous avons donné environ 15pieces de linge (tee shirt, pantalon fin, etc..) et des chaussettes et sous vêtements et la facture a été de 1109 roupi! 16euros de pressing ! Alors qu a Varanasi c était 6 roupi pour les grosses pièces.. un scandale.. au moment de payer nous avons donné 1500 roupi, nous étions agacés et quand nous avons rangé notre monnaie nous nous sommes rendus compte qu’il ne nous avait rendu que 300 roupi..
Nous sommes très déçu car l hôtel est joli mais le personnel est incapable et il faut même s en méfier..
